en: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1829 Oct. 21

This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from Thursday October 21, 1829, on which date three cases involving a stolen horse, debt, and a murder were heard before the Court. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

none: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1829 Oct. 21 : page 1

body.value: Wensday Wednesday 21st October Horace Brown vs Nancy & Sally Miller Recover for a stolen horse The court aquit acquit the defts. defendants 21st Octr. October S. Ballard vs. Jno John Helderbrand Debt on note The court find for the defendend defendant Cherokee Nation vs Noo.cha.wee On the charge of murder . The court concur with the decition decision of the sentence having been passed in the circuit court, this court decide that they have no power to take it up of susspending suspending the sentence of Said Circuit court. 19th October. Court adjourned to Thursday morning at 10 Oclock
